metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: CSS 2D Transforms
CSS 2D Transforms
CSS transforms allow you to move, rotate, scale, and skew elements.
content.html: CSS transforms allow you to move, rotate, scale, and skew elements.

content.text: Mouse over the element below to see a 2D transformation:
content.html: Mouse over the element below to see a 2D transformation:

content.text: In this chapter you will learn about the following CSS property:
content.html: In this chapter you will learn about the following CSS property:

content.text: CSS 2D Transforms Functions
With the CSS transform property you can use the following 2D transformation functions:
content.html: With the CSS transform property you can use the following 2D transformation functions:

content.text: Tip: You will learn about 3D transformations in the next chapter.
content.html: Tip: You will learn about 3D transformations in the next chapter.

content.text: The translate() Function
The translate() function moves an element from its current position (according to the parameters given for the X-axis and the Y-axis).
content.html: The translate() function moves an element from its current position (according to the parameters given for the X-axis and the Y-axis).

content.text: The following example moves the <div> element 50 pixels to the right, and 100 pixels down from its current position:
content.html: The following example moves the <div> element 50 pixels to the right, and 100 pixels down from its current position:

content.code_html:
div {
  transform: translate(50px, 100px);
}

content.text: The rotate() Function
The rotate() function rotates an element clockwise or counter-clockwise according to a given degree.
content.html: The rotate() function rotates an element clockwise or counter-clockwise according to a given degree.

content.text: The following example rotates the <div> element clockwise with 20 degrees:
content.html: The following example rotates the <div> element clockwise with 20 degrees:

content.code_html:
div {
  transform: rotate(20deg);
}

content.text: Using negative values will rotate the element counter-clockwise.
content.html: Using negative values will rotate the element counter-clockwise.

content.text: The following example rotates the <div> element counter-clockwise with 20 degrees:
content.html: The following example rotates the <div> element counter-clockwise with 20 degrees:

content.code_html:
div {
  transform: rotate(-20deg);
}

content.text: The scale() Function
The scale() function increases or decreases the size of an element (according to the parameters given for the width and height).
content.html: The scale() function increases or decreases the size of an element (according to the parameters given for the width and height).

content.text: The following example increases the <div> element to be two times of its original width, and three times of its original height:
content.html: The following example increases the <div> element to be two times of its original width, and three times of its original height:

content.code_html:
div {
  transform: scale(2, 3);
}

content.text: The following example decreases the <div> element to be half of its original width and height:
content.html: The following example decreases the <div> element to be half of its original width and height:

content.code_html:
div {
  transform: scale(0.5, 0.5);
}

content.text: The scaleX() Function
The scaleX() function increases or decreases the width of an element.
content.html: The scaleX() function increases or decreases the width of an element.

content.text: The following example increases the <div> element to be two times of its original width:
content.html: The following example increases the <div> element to be two times of its original width:

content.code_html:
div {
  transform: scaleX(2);
}

content.text: The following example decreases the <div> element to be half of its original width:
content.html: The following example decreases the <div> element to be half of its original width:

content.code_html:
div {
  transform: scaleX(0.5);
}

content.text: The scaleY() Function
The scaleY() function increases or decreases the height of an element.
content.html: The scaleY() function increases or decreases the height of an element.

content.text: The following example increases the <div> element to be three times of its original height:
content.html: The following example increases the <div> element to be three times of its original height:

content.code_html:
div {
  transform: scaleY(3);
}

content.text: The following example decreases the <div> element to be half of its original height:
content.html: The following example decreases the <div> element to be half of its original height:

content.code_html:
div {
  transform: scaleY(0.5);
}

content.text: The skewX() Function
The skewX() function skews an element along the X-axis by the given angle.
content.html: The skewX() function skews an element along the X-axis by the given angle.

content.text: The following example skews the <div> element 20 degrees along the X-axis:
content.html: The following example skews the <div> element 20 degrees along the X-axis:

content.code_html:
div {
  transform: skewX(20deg);
}

content.text: The skewY() Function
The skewY() function skews an element along the Y-axis by the given angle.
content.html: The skewY() function skews an element along the Y-axis by the given angle.

content.text: The following example skews the <div> element 20 degrees along the Y-axis:
content.html: The following example skews the <div> element 20 degrees along the Y-axis:

content.code_html:
div {
  transform: skewY(20deg);
}

content.text: The skew() Function
The skew() function skews an element along the X and Y-axis by the given angles.
content.html: The skew() function skews an element along the X and Y-axis by the given angles.

content.text: The following example skews the <div> element 20 degrees along the X-axis, and 10 degrees along the Y-axis:
content.html: The following example skews the <div> element 20 degrees along the X-axis, and 10 degrees along the Y-axis:

content.code_html:
div {
  transform: skew(20deg, 10deg);
}

content.text: If the second parameter is not specified, it has a zero value. So, the following example skews the <div> element 20 degrees along the X-axis:
content.html: If the second parameter is not specified, it has a zero value. So, the following example skews the <div> element 20 degrees along the X-axis:

content.code_html:
div {
  transform: skew(20deg);
}

content.text: The matrix() Function
The matrix() function combines all the 2D transform functions into one.
content.html: The matrix() function combines all the 2D transform functions into one.

content.text: The matrix() function take six parameters, containing mathematic functions, which allows you to rotate, scale, move (translate), and skew elements.
content.html: The matrix() function take six parameters, containing mathematic functions, which allows you to rotate, scale, move (translate), and skew elements.

content.text: The parameters are as follow: matrix(scaleX(), skewY(), skewX(), scaleY(), translateX(), translateY())
content.html: The parameters are as follow: matrix(scaleX(), skewY(), skewX(), scaleY(), translateX(), translateY())

content.code_html:
div {
  transform: matrix(1, -0.3, 0, 1, 0, 0);
}

content.text: CSS Transform Properties
The following table lists all the 2D transform properties:
content.html: The following table lists all the 2D transform properties:

content.code_html:
Property Description
transform Applies a 2D or 3D transformation to an element
transform-origin Allows you to change the position on transformed elements

content.text: CSS 2D Transform Functions

content.code_html:
Function Description
matrix() Defines a 2D transformation, using a matrix of six values
translate() Defines a 2D translation, moving the element along the X- and the Y-axis
translateX() Defines a 2D translation, moving the element along the X-axis
translateY() Defines a 2D translation, moving the element along the Y-axis
scale() Defines a 2D scale transformation, scaling the elements width and height
scaleX() Defines a 2D scale transformation, scaling the element's width
scaleY() Defines a 2D scale transformation, scaling the element's height
rotate() Defines a 2D rotation, the angle is specified in the parameter
skew() Defines a 2D skew transformation along the X- and the Y-axis
skewX() Defines a 2D skew transformation along the X-axis
skewY() Defines a 2D skew transformation along the Y-axis
